list_definition.definition: (of a heavy weight) to fall or drop swiftly

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The rock plummeted to the bottom of the cliff.

list_definition.definition: an indicator hung down to see if something is vertical.

list_ex_of_english: It is a deep matter, an abysmal one, which no plummet of ours will sound.
Following the recession in 1991-1993, sales of robots plummeted to about 55,000 units in 1993.
As a consequence, the economic status of priests plummeted, making entry into the clergy less attractive.
Unsurprisingly, prosecutions for poaching plummeted precisely in areas of the country where the late nineteenth-century revolution in food supply and diet was most evident.
At the same time, the rats give up eating and their body weights plummet.
Following the recession in 1991-1993, worldwide sales of industrial robots plummeted to about 54,000 units in 1993.
Following the recession of 1991 to 1993, sales of robots plummeted to about 55,000 units in 1993.
This trend accelerated in the 1990s, as the number of moderate and cross-pressured members plummeted.
